br.eti.rslemos.bitsmagic

Class Xor

  • java.lang.Object
    • br.eti.rslemos.bitsmagic.Xor

  • public class Xor
extends Object
    This class consists exclusively of static methods that xor bits over arrays of integral primitive type.

    For every method available in this class, the arguments that represent offsets should always be given in bits, and are 0-based. For more information about bit mapping in arrays of integral primitive types see Store class.

    The general syntax for methods in this class conforms to that of System.arraycopy(java.lang.Object, int, java.lang.Object, int, int).

    Access to offlimits bits, either for reading or for writing, will throw ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException. In this case destination will be left unchanged.

    In case of using the same underlying storage for both source and destination, all methods of this class behave as if copying the bits first to a temporary location, then xor'ing them over the destination.

    NullPointerException is thrown if either given array is null.

    All methods are inherently thread unsafe: in case of more than one thread acting upon the same storage the results are undefined. Also neither they acquire nor block on any monitor. Any necessary synchronization should be done externally.

    Since:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Rodrigo Lemos

    • Method Detail

      • xorFrom

        public static void xorFrom(byte[] source,
                           int srcPos,
                           byte[] dest,
                           int destPos,
                           int length)
        Xors bits from the specified source storage, beginning at the specified bit, onto the specified bits of the destination storage. A region of bits is xor'ed from the source storage referenced by source to the destination storage referenced by dest. The number of bits xor'ed is equal to the length argument. The bits at offsets srcPos through srcPos+length-1 in the source storage are xor'ed into positions destPos through destPos+length-1, respectively, of the destination storage.
        Parameters:
        source - the source storage.
        srcPos - starting bit in the source storage.
        dest - the destination storage.
        destPos - starting bit in the destination storage.
        length - the number of bits to be xor'ed.
        Since:
        1.0.0
